item.title: Context Overview
item.description: Summary # Variables can be injected into a step’s inputs based on the results of other steps, utilizing what is known as the “Context.” The Context proves invaluable in various scenarios. For instance, it allows you to update a record using data generated by a previous “create-record” step. Additionally, you can log error results using a “try-catch” step or create a record using data derived from action parameters. Context stack # Adding items to the context stack # Certain steps have the capability to output their results into the execution context of Flows.
